TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed ViewStateEncryptionMode extends System.Enum

Docs.summary: Specifies whether view-state information is encrypted.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.ViewStateEncryptionMode> enumeration provides values for specifying whether the view-state information in a <xref:System.Web.UI.Page> object is encrypted. The <xref:System.Web.UI.ViewStateEncryptionMode> value can be set only in the [@ Page](http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/f06cf9e5-22bb-461d-8b8f-549e53ff40a4) directive or in the section of the configuration file.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates setting the view-state encryption mode for a <xref:System.Web.UI.Page> object and requesting encryption of the view-state information through the <xref:System.Web.UI.Page.RegisterRequiresViewStateEncryption%2A> method. In this example, the view-state information will be encrypted when customer information is retrieved from a database.
<!-- TODO: review snippet reference [!code-csharp[System.Web.UI.ViewStateEncryptionMode#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_WebNet/System.Web.UI.ViewStateEncryptionMode/CS/encryptViewState.cs.aspx#1)] --> <!-- TODO: review snippet reference [!code-vb[System.Web.UI.ViewStateEncryptionMode#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WebNet/System.Web.UI.ViewStateEncryptionMode/VB/encryptViewState.vb.aspx#1)] -->

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Web.UI.ViewStateEncryptionMode Always = int32(1)

Docs.summary: The view-state information is always encrypted.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Web.UI.ViewStateEncryptionMode Auto = int32(0)

Docs.summary: The view-state information is encrypted if a control requests encryption by calling the method. This is the default.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Web.UI.ViewStateEncryptionMode Never = int32(2)

Docs.summary: The view-state information is never encrypted, even if a control requests it.
